meanings.definition: A structural piece of stone, wood, or metal jutting from a wall to support a weight.
meanings.sent1: The ancient castle had intricate corbels supporting its towering walls.
meanings.sent2: The mason carefully placed the corbels to ensure the wall's stability.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the corbels as stepping stones to climb the wall.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the corbels that held up her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The corbels stood out like loyal soldiers, holding up the wall with unwavering strength.

meanings.sent1: The carpenter will corbel the archway to add a decorative touch.
meanings.sent2: They decided to corbel the balcony for added support.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly offered to corbel the treehouse with Lego bricks.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to corbel the community together.
meanings.sent5: The love and care she put into her work corbeled each piece with precision.

meanings.definition: To support by means of corbels.
meanings.sent1: The ancient structure was corbeled to withstand the test of time.
meanings.sent2: The bridge was corbeled to bear the weight of passing cars.
meanings.sent3: The idea of using marshmallows to corbel the cake seemed ridiculous.
meanings.sent4: His words corbeled her confidence, giving her the strength to speak up.
meanings.sent5: The friendship between them corbeled each other through tough times.
